findings.LIVER: The hepatic parenchyma appears within normal limits. The contour of the liver is smooth. There is no focal liver mass. The main portal vein is patent with hepatopetal flow. There is no ascites.
findings.BILE DUCTS: There is no intrahepatic biliary dilation. The CHD measures 6 mm.
findings.GALLBLADDER: A non mobile shadowing gallstone is seen in the gallbladder neck measuring up to 2.3 cm in diameter. There is associated gallbladder distention. There is minimal gallbladder wall edema, less pronounced than on the recent CT. There is no associated pericholecystic fluid.
findings.PANCREAS: The pancreas is not well visualized, largely obscured by overlying bowel gas.
findings.KIDNEYS: Limited views of the right kidney show no hydronephrosis.
findings.RETROPERITONEUM: The visualized portions of aorta and IVC are within normal limits.
